author: Mike Rivero
title: Germany can mediate with Moscow over Syria, foreign minister says
text:
April 17, 2018 / 9:59 AM / a day ago Germany can mediate with Moscow over Syria, foreign minister says Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
BERLIN (Reuters) - Germany has a special intermediary role allowing it to keep open the window for dialogue with Russia on the Syrian crisis, German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas said on Tuesday. 
At a Berlin news conference alongside Canadian Foreign Minister Chrystia Freeland, Maas also said the stalled Syrian peace process would be discussed at the weekend’s Toronto summit of G7 foreign ministers. 
“We have to use this moment to get the political process going again,” he said of the meeting, where Russia will not be present. “We also need Russia for this dialogue,” he added, suggesting Germany’s traditionally closer relationship with Russia could help facilitate this. Reporting by Sabine Siebold, writing by Thomas Escritt; Editing by Paul Carrel
